intro: Gluta wallichii subsp. lafrankiei, commonly known as the Lafrankie's gluta, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. It is often found in lowland and hill forest areas, thriving in humid and shaded environments. The subspecies is distinguished by its unique leaf morphology and floral structure compared to other members of the Gluta genus.
